intro: Bossiaea rufa var. oxyclada, commonly known as the red bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and dense, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, bright red flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. The variety oxyclada is distinguished by its more elongated leaves and slightly different floral structure compared to the typical form of B. rufa.
